perturbation.original_text: "Customer" means a third party who purchases the Products from Reseller within the Territory, for its internal use only (including for the personal use of its End Users), such as nursing homes. "End User" means a third party who is a customer of Customer or is otherwise related to a customer of Customer, and who purchases and/or uses the Products within the Territory, for its personal use only.
perturbation.changed_text: "Customer" means a third party who purchases the Products from Reseller within the Territory, for its internal use only. "End User" means a third party who purchases the Products directly from the Supplier for their internal use. Such as nursing homes.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of 'End User' is changed to state they purchase directly from the 'Supplier,' contradicting the original definition and the overall reseller agreement structure where 'Reseller' is meant to sell to the 'Customer,' who then may have 'End Users'. This creates confusion about who the 'End User' actually purchases from and bypasses the Reseller.

perturbation.original_text: Supplier will retain access to diagnostics, telemetric data and analytics generated by the Product. The data shall be uploaded to Supplier's Firebase server in a timely manner. A server interface will be embedded within the software package provided by the Supplier. Distributor will maintain Supplier's interface to the server and access to such data within the Product; provided that the data and analytics to be received by the Supplier shall, in all cases, not be in violation of any applicable privacy or other law.
perturbation.changed_text: Supplier will retain access to diagnostics, telemetric data and analytics generated by the Product. The data shall be uploaded to Supplier's Firebase server in a timely manner. A server interface will be embedded within the software package provided by the Supplier. Reseller will maintain Supplier's interface to the server and access to such data within the Product; provided that the data and analytics to be received by the Supplier shall, in all cases, not be in violation of any applicable privacy or other law.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Distributor' is replaced with 'Reseller', changing who is responsible for maintaining the server interface. Since the agreement defines 'Reseller' but not 'Distributor,' this creates ambiguity and could lead to disputes about who has the obligation to maintain the server interface.

perturbation.original_text: In addition to the foregoing, if, at the time of termination of this Agreement, Reseller shall have additional Product units in its inventory and is able to sell them to Customers and/or End Users (including, without limitation, any Product units for which Reseller has or is obligated to pay the Supplier the purchase price therefor but which have not yet been delivered to the Reseller by Supplier, which Supplier hereby agrees to either deliver as otherwise contemplated by this Agreement as if it had not terminated or to refund the purchase price therefor), then the licenses and appointments described in Section 2 shall remain in effect with respect to such unsold Product units (and such Section 2 shall not terminate) until the earlier of (i) the date on which the last Product in Reseller's inventory is sold to a Customer and/or End User, or (ii) 1 year from the date of the termination of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: In addition to the foregoing, if, at the time of termination of this Agreement, Reseller shall have additional Product units in its inventory and is able to sell them to Clients and/or End Users (including, without limitation, any Product units for which Reseller has or is obligated to pay the Supplier the purchase price therefor but which have not yet been delivered to the Reseller by Supplier, which Supplier hereby agrees to either deliver as otherwise contemplated by this Agreement as if it had not terminated or to refund the purchase price therefor), then the licenses and appointments described in Section 2 shall remain in effect with respect to such unsold Product units (and such Section 2 shall not terminate) until the earlier of (i) the date on which the last Product in Reseller's inventory is sold to a Client and/or End User, or (ii) 1 year from the date of the termination of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Customers' is replaced with 'Clients', creating uncertainty. It's undefined whether 'Customers' and 'Clients' refer to the same entities. This leads to possible disputes on sales scope post-termination.
